0:
--------------------
Text: The Jewish Hungarian family of Mendel is the name of a prominent Hungarian family which flourished in the latter half of the 15th century and in the first half of the sixteenth in Ofen (Buda).
Triplets:<The Jewish Hungarian family of Mendel
1:
--------------------
Text: Mendel (Hungarian family):  Members of three generations of it are known; namely, Jacob, Israel, and Isaac Mendel, who held the office of "Princeps Judæorum", "Supremus Judæorum," or "Præfectus Judæorum" between 1482 and 1539.
Triplets:<Jacob
2: give the Jews an accredited representative at court

--------------------
Text: Mendel (Hungarian family):  This office, which seems to have existed only during that period, was created by King Matthias Corvinus in order to give the Jews an accredited representative at court, who at the same time should be responsible for the payment of their taxes.

Triplets:
<Mendel
3:
<Text: Mendel (Hungarian family):  The "Præfectus Judæorum" was empowered to impose fines and other penalties on the Jews.>
Triplets:<Mendel
